metadata.title: CVE-2022-20009 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In various functions of the USB gadget subsystem, there is a possible outof bounds write due to a missing bounds check. This could lead to localescalation of privilege with no additional execution privileges needed.User interaction is not needed for exploitation.Product: AndroidVersions:Android kernelAndroid ID: A-213172319References: Upstream kernel

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-20009` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1080-fips - 4.4.0-1080.87
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1080-fips - 4.4.0-1080.87
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-1080-fips - 4.4.0-1080.87
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.4.0-1080-fips - 4.4.0-1080.87
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
